summary: Candida albicans is a commensal fungus that colonizes different areas of the human body. it can become pathogenic and cause local or systemic infections in immunocompromised subjects. neutropenia is a hallmark risk factor for development of disseminated candidasis. human immunodeficiency virus-infected patients are more susceptible to mucosal candidiasis (1, 2).
